tasks.title: Make live tests opt-in and split client live tests under size limits
evidence: make ci output shows live tests ran even with SKIP_LIVE_TESTS=1: 'Skipping live tests (SKIP_LIVE_TESTS=1)' followed by 'Running tests/live_tests.rs' for splunk-client and splunk-cli.
rg -n '#\[ignore\]' crates/client/tests/live_tests.rs crates/cli/tests/live_tests.rs returned no matches (no ignored tests).
wc -l crates/client/tests/live_tests.rs => 731 (file exceeds 700 LOC guideline).
plan: Mark all live tests in crates/client/tests/live_tests.rs and crates/cli/tests/live_tests.rs with #[ignore] or gate them behind a dedicated feature so they do not run in default cargo test.
Split crates/client/tests/live_tests.rs into per-concept test files (auth, search, kvstore, etc.) to keep each file under 700 LOC while preserving test names and behavior.
Update any references or documentation if required so make test-live remains the intended entrypoint for live tests.

Verify by running `cargo test --workspace --all-targets --all-features` (live tests should be skipped) and `SKIP_LIVE_TESTS=1 make ci` (no live test execution), then `make test-live` to confirm ignored live tests can still be run explicitly.

tasks.title: Optimize make ci to remove release build requirement while keeping core checks
evidence: User reports 'make ci' takes far too long due to multiple builds and extensive builds.
Current Makefile ci target runs: install -> format -> lint-secrets -> lint -> test -> test-live -> release (with install) -> lint-docs.
The release target builds with --profile ci and installs binaries to ~/.local/bin.
User wants to keep: code formatting, schema generation, linting and lint fixing, type-checking, and building (but NOT require a true release build every time).
User wants to drop: building a true release every time AND the binary install step.
AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md both document the Makefile contract and ci target behavior that must be updated.
Makefile line 130-143: ci target currently depends on release which builds and installs binaries.
plan: Modify Makefile ci target to remove release build and binary install steps.
Add type-check target to ci (user explicitly wants this kept).
Ensure ci still runs: install, format, lint-secrets, lint, type-check, test, test-live, generate, lint-docs.
Update AGENTS.md Makefile contract section to reflect new ci behavior.
Update CLAUDE.md Makefile contract section to reflect new ci behavior.
Update any docs/ files that reference the ci target behavior.
Verify make ci passes with the new configuration.
tasks.request: The current CI gate 'make ci' takes far too long to execute due to the multiple builds and extensive builds. I want to keep code formatting, schema generation, linting and lint fixing, type-checking, and building (yes, keeping building if possible but no longer REQUIRE building a true release EVERY time CI is executed), and since we can drop building a true release everytime we can drop the binary install step. I want this change planned, implemented, and executed. I want all docs, including AGENTS.md, updated with my new requirements.
